  33DEBUG_MODE = True
  34"""Boolean which will allow the print_debug function to print debug messages to the console if set to True"""
  35SHOW_ON_PARENT_DEBUG = False
  36"""Boolean condition for the print_debug which will allow "ON PARENT" messages to be printed if set to True"""
  37
  38
  39def print_debug(*args, **kwargs):
  40    """
  41    Function is used to print debug messages to the console
  42
  43    @param args: objects which can be converted to strings
  44    @param kwargs: keyword arguments
  45    """
  46    if "info" in kwargs:
  47        if kwargs["info"] == "ON PARENT" and not SHOW_ON_PARENT_DEBUG:
  48            return
  49    if not DEBUG_MODE:
  50        return
  51    elif "info" in kwargs:
  52        info = kwargs["info"]
  53        del kwargs["info"]
  54        print("\033[1;31mDEBUG_PRINT |\033[1;32m", info, "|\033[0;37m", *args, **kwargs)
  55    else:
  56        print("\033[1;31mDEBUG_PRINT |\033[0m", *args, **kwargs)
  57
  58
  59def select_directory_dialog(prompt: str = "Select a directory") -> str:
  60    """
  61    uses the wxPython library to use the file explorer dialog to select a directory
  62
  63    @param prompt: prompt which is displayed at the top of the dialog
  64    @return: a string to the path
  65
  66    used https://docs.wxpython.org/wx.DirDialog.html for reference
  67    """
  68    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
  69    app = wx.App()
  70    directory_dialog = wx.DirDialog(None, prompt)
  71    directory_dialog.ShowModal()
  72    path = directory_dialog.GetPath()
  73    if path == "":
  74        path = None
  75    directory_dialog.Destroy()
  76    return path
  77
  78
  79def select_file_dialog(prompt: str = "Select a file", wildcard: str = "") -> str:
  80    """
  81    uses the wxPython library to use the file explorer dialog to select a file
  82    used https://docs.wxpython.org/wx.FileDialog.html for reference
  83
  84    @param prompt: prompt which is displayed at the top of the dialog
  85    @param wildcard: wildcard parameter is used to filter which files are shown and accepted
  86    @return: a string to the path
  87    """
  88    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
  89    app = wx.App()
  90    file_dialog = wx.FileDialog(None, prompt, wildcard=wildcard)
  91    file_dialog.ShowModal()
  92    path = file_dialog.GetPath()
  93    file_dialog.Destroy()
  94    return path

  97def find_id(parent: Widget, widget: Widget) -> str:
  98    """
  99    function finds the id of the widget in the parent widget's ids dictionary
 100
 101    @param parent: the parent widget
 102    @param widget: widget to find the id of
 103    @return: the id of the widget in the ids of the parent widget
 104    @deprecated: this function is planned to be removed
 105    """
 106    for key, value in parent.ids.items():
 107        if value == widget:
 108            return key
 109    return ""

 112class MCUSelectionScreen(Screen):
 113    """
 114    The MCU selection screen allows the user to select the MCU they would like to use for their keyboard
 115    """
 116
 117
 118
 119
 120    class MCUButton(Button):
 121        """
 122        MCUButton is a button which is used to select the MCU
 123        """
 124
 125        def __init__(self, mcu_class: ZMK.MCUs.AbstractMCU, **kwargs):
 126            """
 127            @param mcu_class: the class of the MCU
 128            @param kwargs: keyword arguments
 129            """
 130            super().__init__(**kwargs)
 131            self.size_hint_y = None
 132            self.height = std.STD_BUTTON_HEIGHT * 1.5
 133            self.size_hint_x = 0.25
 134            self.font_size = std.STD_FONT_SIZE
 135            self.McuClass = mcu_class
 136
 137        def on_release(self):
 138            """
 139            on_release is called when the button is released
 140            """
 141            main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 142            try:
 143                print_debug(f"MCUButton.on_release: {self.McuClass}")
 144                main_window.zmk_config.set_mcu(self.McuClass)
 145            except TypeError as error:
 146                main_window.zmk_error(error)
 147            main_window.screen_manager.current = "Properties"
 148            properties_screen: PropertiesScreen = main_window.screen_manager.get_screen("Properties")
 149            properties_screen.update_mcu_text()
 150
 151
 152
 153
 154    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
 155        super().__init__(**kwargs)
 156        self.stack_layout = StackLayout(size_hint=(1, 1), orientation="tb-lr", spacing=std.STD_SPACING * 2,
 157                                        padding=std.STD_SPACING * 2)
 158        """StackLayout is used for this screen as it allows to create list of buttons"""
 159        self.add_widget(self.stack_layout)
 160        # gets the list of the MCUs which have been implemented in the ZMK package
 161        self.mcu_list = [_class for _class in ZMK.MCUs.__dict__.values() if
 162                         isinstance(_class, type) and issubclass(_class, ZMK.MCUs.AbstractMCU)
 163                         and _class != ZMK.MCUs.AbstractMCU]
 164        """list of the MCUs which have been implemented in the ZMK package"""
 165
 166    def on_parent(self, widget: MCUSelectionScreen, parent: ScreenManager):
 167        """
 168        on_parent is called when this widget is added to a parent widget
 169
 170        @param widget: self
 171        @param parent: parent widget, ScreenManager
 172        """
 173        print_debug(f"{self.__class__.__name__}: {widget} {parent}", info="ON PARENT")
 174        if not self.stack_layout.children and parent:
 175            self.create_mcu_buttons()
 176
 177    def create_mcu_buttons(self):
 178        """
 179        Creates the buttons for the MCU selection screen which allow the user to select the MCU for their keyboard
 180        """
 181        for mcu in self.mcu_list:
 182            print_debug(f"MCUSelectionScreen.create_mcu_buttons: {mcu}")
 183            button = self.MCUButton(text=str(mcu.__name__), mcu_class=mcu())
 184            self.stack_layout.add_widget(button)
 185

 203        """BoxLayout is used to create a vertical list of properties"""
 204        self.add_widget(self.box_layout)

 457    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
 458    def on_select_working_directory(self, button: Button):
 459        """
 460        callback for when the select working directory button is pressed
 461        """
 462        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 463        directory_path = select_directory_dialog(
 464            "Select Working Directory, top level directory which holds the github repository")
 465        if directory_path:
 466            try:
 467                main_window.zmk_config.set_working_directory(directory_path)
 468                self.update_directory_path(directory_path)
 469            except Exception as error:
 470                main_window.zmk_error(error)
 471
 472    def update_directory_path(self, directory_path: str = None):
 473        """
 474        updates the directory path
 475
 476        @param directory_path: the directory path as a string or None, if it is None it will attempt to get the
 477        directory path from the main window
 478        """
 479        if directory_path is None:
 480            main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 481            if main_window is not None:
 482                directory_path = main_window.zmk_config.get_working_directory()
 483
 484        self.box_layout.ids["working directory"].text = directory_path if directory_path else "No Directory Selected"
 485
 486    @staticmethod
 487    def on_config_name_focus(text_input: TextInput, focus: bool):
 488        """
 489        Callback for when the text input for the config name is focused or unfocused, if it is unfocused it is assumed
 490        that the user has finished with the text input. so the method will attempt to set the config name.
 491        """
 492        if focus:
 493            return
 494        # this is not strictly necessary to make a reference to the MainWindow, but it makes the type checking happy
 495        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 496        current_config_name = main_window.zmk_config.get_config_name()
 497        # attempt to set the config name
 498        try:
 499            main_window.zmk_config.set_config_name(name=str(text_input.text))
 500        # it is "possible" to get a TypeError but because the text input is a string it should not happen
 501        # hence why I added the extra message.
 502        except TypeError as error:
 503            error.args = (str(error) + ". If you got this error then you have managed to break something")
 504            main_window.zmk_error(error)
 505            text_input.text = current_config_name if current_config_name else ""
 506        # if the config name already exists then raise a ValueError
 507        except ValueError as error:
 508            main_window.zmk_error(error)
 509            text_input.text = current_config_name if current_config_name else ""
 510
 511    @staticmethod
 512    def on_config_id_focus(text_input: TextInput, focus: bool):
 513        """
 514        Callback for when the text input for the config id is focused or unfocused, if it is unfocused it is assumed
 515        that the user has finished with the text input. so the method will attempt to set the config id.
 516        """
 517        if focus:
 518            return
 519        # this is not strictly necessary to make a reference to the MainWindow, but it makes the type checking happy
 520        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 521        current_config_id = main_window.zmk_config.get_config_id()
 522        try:
 523            main_window.zmk_config.set_config_id(config_id=str(text_input.text))
 524        # it is "possible" to get a TypeError but considering that the config_id is a string it should never happen
 525        # hence why I added to the error message
 526        except TypeError as error:
 527            error.args = (str(error) + ". If you got this error then you have managed to break something")
 528            main_window.zmk_error(error)
 529            text_input.text = current_config_id if current_config_id else ""
 530        # if the config id already exists then it will raise a ValueError
 531        except ValueError as error:
 532            main_window.zmk_error(error)
 533            text_input.text = current_config_id if current_config_id else ""
 534
 535    @staticmethod
 536    def on_shield_directory_focus(text_input: TextInput, focus: bool):
 537        """
 538        Callback for when the text input for the shield directory is focused or unfocused, if it is unfocused it is
 539        assumed that the user has finished with the text input. so the method will attempt to set the shield directory.
 540        """
 541        if focus:
 542            return
 543        # this is not strictly necessary to make a reference to the MainWindow, but it makes the type checking happy
 544        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 545        current_shield_directory = main_window.zmk_config.get_shield_directory()
 546        # attempts to set the shield directory
 547        try:
 548            main_window.zmk_config.set_shield_directory(shield_directory=str(text_input.text))
 549        # it is a "possible" error but given that the text input is a string it should never happen
 550        # hence why I wrote the error message like this
 551        except TypeError as error:
 552            error.args = (str(error) + ". If you got this error then you have managed to break something")
 553            main_window.zmk_error(error)
 554            text_input.text = current_shield_directory if current_shield_directory else ""
 555        # if the directory already exists then it will raise a ValueError

 557            main_window.zmk_error(error)
 558            text_input.text = current_shield_directory if current_shield_directory else ""

 560    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
 561    def on_select_json_file(self, button: Button):
 562        """
 563        callback for when the select json file button is pressed
 564        """
 565        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 566        json_file_path = select_file_dialog("Select JSON File, file that contains the keyboard layout",
 567                                            wildcard="*.json")
 568        if json_file_path and json_file_path != main_window.json_file_path:
 569            try:
 570                # attempt to parse the json file before setting the json file path to make sure that the json file
 571                # is valid
 572                main_window.kle_json = pykle.parse(open(json_file_path, encoding="utf-8").read())
 573                main_window.json_file_path = json_file_path
 574                # because the json file has changed, the assumption is that the layout has changed and the current
 575                # keymap/row/columns are no longer valid therefore they are cleared and the keymaps are redrawn
 576                main_window.zmk_config.clear_key_data()
 577                main_window.redraw_keymap()
 578            except Exception as error:
 579                main_window.zmk_error(error)
 580        # update the json file path in the GUI
 581        self.update_json_file_path()
 582
 583    def update_json_file_path(self, json_file_path: str = None):
 584        """
 585        updates the json file path, if no file path is passed then it will attempt to get the file path from the main
 586        window
 587        """
 588        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 589        if main_window is None:
 590            return
 591        json_file_path = main_window.json_file_path if json_file_path is None else json_file_path
 592        self.box_layout.ids["kle json path"].text = json_file_path if json_file_path else "No JSON File Selected"
 593

 614    def split_config_text_callback(self, toggle_button: ToggleButton):
 615        """
 616        Flipflops the text on the button for enabling the split keyboard between "Yes" and "No"
 617        """
 618        # used to enable or disable the split keyboard side toggle button
 619        split_keyboard_side = self.box_layout.ids["split keyboard side"]
 620        if toggle_button.state == "down":
 621            toggle_button.text = "Yes"
 622            split_keyboard_side.disabled = False
 623        else:
 624            toggle_button.text = "No"
 625            split_keyboard_side.disabled = True
 626        # update the text on the split keyboard side toggle button
 627        self.split_config_side_text_callback(split_keyboard_side)
 628
 629    @staticmethod
 630    def split_config_side_text_callback(toggle_button: ToggleButton):
 631        """
 632        Flipflops the text on the button for enabling the split keyboard between "Left" and "Right"
 633        """
 634        if toggle_button.disabled:
 635            toggle_button.text = "N/A"
 636        elif toggle_button.state == "down":
 637            toggle_button.text = "Right"
 638        else:
 639            toggle_button.text = "Left"
 640
 641    def split_config_side_enabled(self, toggle_button: ToggleButton):
 642        """
 643        Enables the button for selecting the side of the split keyboard
 644        """
 645        if toggle_button.state == "down":
 646            self.box_layout.ids["split keyboard"].disabled = True
 647        else:
 648            self.box_layout.ids["split keyboard"].disabled = True
 649        print_debug("method called: split config side enabled")
 650
 651    def encoder_config_toggle_text_call_back(self, toggle_button: ToggleButton):
 652        """
 653        Flipflops the text on the toggle button between "Yes" and "No"
 654        """
 655        if toggle_button.state == "down":
 656            toggle_button.text = "Yes"
 657            self.box_layout.ids["number of rotary encoders"].disabled = False
 658        else:
 659            toggle_button.text = "No"
 660            self.box_layout.ids["number of rotary encoders"].disabled = True
 661

 664        """
 665        Flipflops the text on the toggle button between "Left" and "Right"
 666        """
 667        if toggle_button.state == "down":
 668            toggle_button.text = "Right"
 669        else:
 670            toggle_button.text = "Left"

 680    def on_text_intput_focus(self, text_input: TextInput, focus: bool) -> None:
 681        """
 682        on_text_intput_focus is called when a text input focus changes, it is used to change the configuration option
 683        once the user clicks away from the text input, so that the configuration can be updated then instead of on every
 684        key press. This method is planned to be deprecated.
 685        """
 686        if focus:
 687            return
 688        key = find_id(self.box_layout, text_input)
 689        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 690        main_window.event_callback(key, value=text_input.text)

 692
 693class KeyWidget(Scatter):
 694    """
 695    This class is a super class which will be used to create keys which will form the visual representation
 696    of the keyboard
 697    """
 698
 699    def __init__(self, key_index: int, **kwargs):
 700        """
 701        The constructor for the KeyWidget class, key_index is taken so that it can fetch the key from the kle data. Then
 702        along with maths it will render the key with the correct size and position, and rotation if needed.
 703
 704        @param key_index: the index of the key in from the pykle.KeyBoard.keys list
 705        """
 706        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 707        key: pykle.Key = main_window.kle_json.keys[key_index]
 708        super().__init__(**kwargs)
 709        self.kivy_y = 0
 710        self.key_index = key_index
 711        self.size_hint = (None, None)
 712        self.size = key.width * std.STD_KEY_UNIT, key.height * std.STD_KEY_UNIT
 713        self.do_translation = False
 714
 715        # if there is rotation in the key, then the maths needs to be figured out to render the key correctly
 716        if key.rotation_angle != 0:
 717            # calculate the centre of the key so that the rotation can be done around the centre of the key
 718            key_center = (key.x + key.width / 2, key.y + key.height / 2)
 719            # storing the point of rotation as a tuple as its easier to work with
 720            point_of_rotation = (key.rotation_x, key.rotation_y)
 721            # calculate the position vector of the centre of the key relative to the point of rotation
 722            rel_position_vector = func.subtract_vectors(key_center, point_of_rotation)
 723            # calculate the magnitude of the position vector
 724            magnitude = func.magnitude(rel_position_vector)
 725            # calculating the new centre position relative to the point of rotation
 726            theta = func.calculate_angle(rel_position_vector)
 727            new_theta = theta - math.radians(key.rotation_angle)
 728            new_rel_position_vector = (magnitude * math.sin(new_theta), magnitude * math.cos(new_theta))
 729            # calculating the position of the bottom left corner of the key relative to the point of rotation
 730            new_rel_bl_pos_vector = (new_rel_position_vector[0] - key.width / 2,
 731                                     new_rel_position_vector[1] + key.height / 2)
 732            # calculating the new position of the bottom left corner of the key
 733            new_bl_pos_vector = func.add_vectors(point_of_rotation, new_rel_bl_pos_vector)
 734            # calculating the new position of the key for kivy
 735            self.kivy_y = new_bl_pos_vector[1] * std.STD_KEY_UNIT
 736            self.pos = (new_bl_pos_vector[0] * std.STD_KEY_UNIT, main_window.screen_manager.height - self.kivy_y)
 737            self.do_rotation = True
 738            self.rotation = -key.rotation_angle
 739        else:
 740            self.do_rotation = False
 741            self.rotation = 0
 742            self.kivy_y = (key.y + key.height) * std.STD_KEY_UNIT
 743            self.pos = (key.x * std.STD_KEY_UNIT, main_window.screen_manager.height - self.kivy_y)
 744
 745        with self.canvas:
 746            Color(1, 1, 1, 0.5)
 747            Rectangle(pos_hint={"center_x": 0.5, "center_y": 0.5},
 748                      size=(key.width * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP,
 749                            key.height * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP))
 750
 751        main_window.screen_manager.bind(height=self.on_height)
 752
 753    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
 754    def on_height(self, screen_manager: ScreenManager, height):
 755        """
 756        on_height is called when the height of the window changes, this is used to update the position of the key to
 757        ensure that it stays at the top of the window
 758
 759        @param screen_manager: the screen manager which is bound to the event
 760        @param height: the new height of the screen_manager widget
 761        """
 762        self.y = height - self.kivy_y
 763
 764
 765class RowColumnScreen(Screen):
 766    """
 767    RowColumnScreen allows user to configure the rows and columns of the keyboard
 768    """
 769
 770
 771
 772
 773    class RowColumnWidget(KeyWidget):
 774        """
 775        Inherits the KeyWidget class and adds box layout to create a widget which can be used to configure the rows and
 776        columns for keys of the keyboard.
 777        """
 778
 779        def __init__(self, index):
 780            """
 781            method adds a box layout which contains two text inputs, one for the row and one for the column
 782
 783            @param index: refer to KeyWidget's constructor for the purpose of this parameter
 784            """
 785            super().__init__(index)
 786            # grabs the key object from the kle json
 787            main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 788            key: pykle.Key = main_window.kle_json.keys[index]
 789            # creates a box layout which will contain the text inputs
 790            box_layout = BoxLayout(orientation="horizontal", size_hint=(None, None), spacing=std.STD_KEY_GAP / 4)
 791            box_layout.pos_hint = {"center_x": 0.5, "center_y": 0.5}
 792            box_layout.size = (key.width * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP,
 793                               key.height * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP)
 794            # creates the text inputs, self.row and self.column are used to store the values of the text inputs
 795            # as integers and are updated when the text of the text inputs are changed if both text inputs are
 796            # integers then the row and column objects in the transform object of the zmk_config object are updated
 797            self.row: int | None = None
 798            self.row_input = TextInput(hint_text="R", input_filter="int", size_hint=(1, 1), multiline=False,
 799                                       halign="center")
 800            self.column: int | None = None
 801            self.row_input.bind(text=self.on_text)
 802            self.col_input = TextInput(hint_text="C", input_filter="int", size_hint=(1, 1), multiline=False,
 803                                       halign="center")
 804            self.col_input.bind(text=self.on_text)
 805            box_layout.add_widget(self.row_input)
 806            box_layout.add_widget(self.col_input)
 807            self.add_widget(box_layout)
 808
 809        def on_text(self, text_input: TextInput, value: str):
 810            """
 811            Method is called when the text of the text input is changed
 812
 813            @param text_input: widget which called the method
 814            @param value: the new text from the text input
 815            """
 816            # if the text input is empty then the value is set to None
 817            if value == "":
 818                value = None
 819
 820            # if the instance of the text input is the row_input
 821            # then the value is set provided that it is not None
 822            if text_input == self.row_input and value is not None:
 823                self.row = int(value)
 824            # otherwise it is safe to assume that the instance is the col_input
 825            # so the value is set provided that it is not None
 826            elif value is not None:
 827                self.column = int(value)
 828
 829            # if both the row and column are integers then the row and column objects in the transform object
 830            if isinstance(self.row, int) and isinstance(self.column, int):
 831                main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 832                transform: ZMK.Transform.MatrixTransform = main_window.zmk_config.get_transform()
 833                # attempts to add the row and column to the transform object
 834                # if an error occurs, which shouldn't happen in the current implementation,
 835                # then the error is displayed to the user
 836                try:
 837                    transform.add_key(self.row, self.column, index=self.key_index)
 838                except Exception as error:
 839                    main_window.zmk_error(error)
 840
 841
 842
 843
 844    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
 845        super().__init__(**kwargs)
 846        self.size_hint = 1, 1
 847        self.float_layout = FloatLayout(size_hint=(1, 1))
 848        """Float layout is used as this allows for absolute positioning of KeyWidgets"""
 849        self.add_widget(self.float_layout)
 850
 851    def on_parent(self, widget: RowColumnScreen, parent: ScreenManager):
 852        """
 853        on_parent is called when this widget is added to a parent widget
 854
 855        @param widget: self
 856        @param parent: the parent widget, ScreenManager
 857        """
 858        print_debug(f"{self.__class__.__name__}: {widget} {parent}", info="ON PARENT")
 859
 860    def redraw_keymap(self):
 861        """
 862        Method is called when the keymap needs to be redrawn
 863        """
 864        self.float_layout.clear_widgets()
 865        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
 866        for index in range(len(main_window.kle_json.keys)):
 867            self.float_layout.add_widget(self.RowColumnWidget(index=index))
 868

1005class ConsoleScreen(Screen):
1006    """
1007    ConsoleScreen allows user to view the console output
1008    """
1009
1010    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
1011        super().__init__(**kwargs)
1012        self.scroll_view = ScrollView(size_hint=(1, 1), do_scroll_x=False, do_scroll_y=True)
1013        self.in_focus = False
1014        self.console_history = []
1015        self.label: [Label, None] = None
1016
1017    def on_parent(self, widget: ConsoleScreen, parent: ScreenManager):
1018        """
1019        on_parent is called when this widget is added to a parent widget
1020
1021        @param widget: self
1022        @param parent: the parent widget, ScreenManager
1023        """
1024        print_debug(f"{self.__class__.__name__}: {widget} {parent}", info="ON PARENT")
1025        if self.parent and not self.scroll_view.children:
1026            # scroll view to hold the console
1027            self.label = Label(text="", font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE)
1028            self.label.size_hint_y = None
1029            self.label.size_hint_x = None
1030            self.label.bind(texture_size=self.label_setter)
1031            self.scroll_view.add_widget(self.label)
1032            self.add_widget(self.scroll_view)
1033
1034    # noinspection PyIncorrectDocstring
1035    def label_setter(self, label: Label, size: tuple[int, int]):
1036        """
1037        label_setter sets the dynamic attributes of the label which is the console
1038
1039        @param size: texture size of the label
1040        @param label: the label widget
1041        """
1042        label.width = self.width
1043        label.height = size[1]
1044        label.text_size = (self.width * 0.98, None)
1045
1046    def update_console(self, console_history: str):
1047        """
1048        update_console updates the console history and the label text
1049
1050        @param console_history: A string which is the latest message to be added to the console
1051        """
1052        self.console_history.append(console_history)
1053        self.label.text = "\n".join(self.console_history)
1054        self.scroll_view.scroll_y = 0
1055

1057class MainWindow(BoxLayout):

1074        # parameters to do with the widget/ gui
1075        self.orientation = "vertical"
1076        self.spacing = std.STD_SPACING
1077
1078        # Code to add the option bar
1079        # ========================================
1080        # initialize the option bar
1081        widget = BoxLayout(
1082            orientation="horizontal",
1083            spacing=std.STD_SPACING,
1084            size_hint_y=None,
1085            height=std.STD_BUTTON_HEIGHT
1086        )
1087        self.add_widget(widget)
1088        self.ids["option bar"] = widget
1089
1090        # ====================
1091        # test button
1092        widget = Button(
1093            text="Test",
1094            size_hint_x=None,
1095            width=metrics.sp(60),
1096            font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE,
1097            on_press=self.on_test_button
1098        )

1100        self.ids["option bar"].ids["test button"] = widget
1101
1102        # ====================
1103        # settings button
1104        widget = Button(
1105            text="Settings",
1106            size_hint_x=None,
1107            width=metrics.sp(80),
1108            font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE,
1109            on_press=self.on_settings_button
1110        )
1111        self.ids["option bar"].add_widget(widget)
1112        self.ids["option bar"].ids["settings button"] = widget
1113
1114        # ====================
1115        # load/save dropdown
1116        self.load_save_dropdown = DropDown()
1117        # creates the option buttons
1118        for option in ("New Config", "Load Config", "Save Config", "Save Config As"):
1119            button = Button(text=option, size_hint_y=None, height=std.STD_BUTTON_HEIGHT)
1120            # using a list with two functions which are called because they have () at the end
1121            # I did this because I did not want to create a new method for, I think it is more readable this way
1122            button.bind(on_release=lambda lambda_button: [
1123                # first function calls the method to close the dropdown
1124                self.load_save_dropdown.select(lambda_button.text),
1125                # second function calls the method in the class to handle that action
1126                # this dictionary acts as a switch statement
1127                {
1128                    "New Config"    : self.on_new_config,
1129                    "Load Config"   : self.on_load_config,
1130                    "Save Config"   : self.on_save_config,
1131                    "Save Config As": self.on_save_config_as
1132                }[lambda_button.text]()
1133            ])
1134            # add button to dropdown
1135            self.load_save_dropdown.add_widget(button)
1136
1137        # add the load/save button
1138        self.ids["option bar"].add_widget(Button(
1139            text="Load/Save",
1140            size_hint_x=None,
1141            width=metrics.sp(120),
1142            font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE,
1143            on_release=self.load_save_dropdown.open
1144        ))
1145
1146        # ====================
1147        # program status bar
1148        widget = Label(
1149            text=f"",
1150            markup=True,
1151            font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE,
1152            halign="left",
1153            valign="center",
1154            padding_x=std.STD_SPACING * 4,
1155        )
1156        self.ids["option bar"].add_widget(widget)
1157        self.ids["option bar"].ids["program status"] = widget
1158        widget.bind(size=widget.setter("text_size"))
1159        # ====================
1160        # console button
1161        widget = Button(
1162            text="Console",
1163            size_hint_x=None,
1164            width=metrics.sp(120),
1165            font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE,
1166            halign="left",
1167            valign="center",
1168            on_press=self.on_console_button
1169        )
1170        self.ids["option bar"].add_widget(widget)
1171        self.ids["option bar"].ids["console button"] = widget
1172
1173        # ========================================
1174        # navigation bar and screen manager
1175        # add the screen manager
1176
1177        # initialize the navigation bar
1178        widget = BoxLayout(
1179            orientation="horizontal",
1180            spacing=std.STD_SPACING,
1181            size_hint_y=None,
1182            height=std.STD_BUTTON_HEIGHT * 1.4
1183        )
1184        self.add_widget(widget)
1185        self.ids["navigation bar"] = widget
1186
1187        # this makes it easier to access the children of the screen manager
1188        # as otherwise you would have quite a nest of widgets
1189        self.screen_manager = ScreenManager(transition=NoTransition())
1190        self.add_widget(self.screen_manager)
1191        self.screen_names = {
1192            "MCU Selection": MCUSelectionScreen,
1193            "Properties"   : PropertiesScreen,
1194            "Row & Column" : RowColumnScreen,
1195            "GPIO"         : GpioScreen,
1196            "Keymap"       : KeymapScreen,
1197            "Export"       : ExportScreen,
1198            "Settings"     : SettingsScreen,
1199            "Console"      : ConsoleScreen
1200        }
1201        accessible_screen_names = ("Properties", "Row & Column", "GPIO", "Keymap", "Export")
1202        # adds the buttons for the different screens to the navigation bar
1203        # as well as the screen to the screen manager
1204        for screen_name in self.screen_names:
1205            # adds buttons for screen names that I want to be accessible in the navigation bar
1206            if screen_name in accessible_screen_names:
1207                button = Button(
1208                    text=screen_name,
1209                    font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE * 1.4,
1210                    on_release=self.on_nav_button
1211                )
1212                self.ids["navigation bar"].add_widget(button)
1213                self.ids["navigation bar"].ids[f"{screen_name} button"] = button
1214            # adds the screen to the screen manager
1215            self.screen_manager.add_widget(self.screen_names[screen_name](name=screen_name))
1216            self.screen_manager.current = screen_name
1217        self.screen_manager.current = "Properties"
1218
1219        # after everything has been added and initialized, the program status is updated
1220        # this is also done here since if it was done at the top when
1221        self.update_console("Program started")
1222

1299    def zmk_error(self, error: str | Exception):
1300        """
1301        The ZMK Package was created so that it could be used in other applications. Therefore, it is possible that
1302        the ZMK Package throw errors (purposefully), this program catches those errors and will display the error
1303        to the user at the top of the window as log it in the internal console. And revert the changes that caused the
1304        error.
1305
1306        @param error: either a string or an exception, if it is an exception, the name of the exception will be added to
1307        the string
1308        """
1309
1310        if isinstance(error, Exception):
1311            error = error.__class__.__name__ + ": " + str(error)
1312            print_debug(f"{error.__class__.__name__}, {error}", info="ZMK Error")
1313        else:
1314            print_debug(error, info="ZMK Error")
1315        self.update_console("ZMK Error: " + error)
1316
1317    def update_console(self, console_str: str):
1318        """
1319        Main method to be called to update the console, it updates the console and the program status
1320        """
1321        console_screen: ConsoleScreen = self.screen_manager.get_screen("Console")
1322        console_screen.update_console(console_str)
1323        self.ids["option bar"].ids["program status"].text = f"[b]Program Status:[/b] [i]{console_str}[/i]"
1324
1325    @staticmethod
1326    def event_callback(widget_id: str = "", **kwargs):
1327        """
1328        Method is called by the children held within the layout of the screens within the screen manager, this is a
1329        callback method which is called when the user changes a value in the configuration
1330
1331        @param widget_id: key is id of the widget which has changed
1332        @param kwargs: a dictionary is used for potential arguments for methods that this method will call
1333        """
1334        # this method is deprecated
1335        print_debug(f"widget_id: {widget_id}, kwargs: {kwargs}", info="Event Callback")

DEBUG_MODE = True

Boolean which will allow the print_debug function to print debug messages to the console if set to True

SHOW_ON_PARENT_DEBUG = False

Boolean condition for the print_debug which will allow "ON PARENT" messages to be printed if set to True

def print_debug(*args, **kwargs): 
40def print_debug(*args, **kwargs):
41    """
42    Function is used to print debug messages to the console
43
44    @param args: objects which can be converted to strings
45    @param kwargs: keyword arguments
46    """
47    if "info" in kwargs:
48        if kwargs["info"] == "ON PARENT" and not SHOW_ON_PARENT_DEBUG:
49            return
50    if not DEBUG_MODE:
51        return
52    elif "info" in kwargs:
53        info = kwargs["info"]
54        del kwargs["info"]
55        print("\033[1;31mDEBUG_PRINT |\033[1;32m", info, "|\033[0;37m", *args, **kwargs)
56    else:
57        print("\033[1;31mDEBUG_PRINT |\033[0m", *args, **kwargs)

Function is used to print debug messages to the console

@param args: objects which can be converted to strings @param kwargs: keyword arguments

def select_directory_dialog(prompt: str = 'Select a directory') -> str: 
60def select_directory_dialog(prompt: str = "Select a directory") -> str:
61    """
62    uses the wxPython library to use the file explorer dialog to select a directory
63
64    @param prompt: prompt which is displayed at the top of the dialog
65    @return: a string to the path
66
67    used https://docs.wxpython.org/wx.DirDialog.html for reference
68    """
69    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
70    app = wx.App()
71    directory_dialog = wx.DirDialog(None, prompt)
72    directory_dialog.ShowModal()
73    path = directory_dialog.GetPath()
74    if path == "":
75        path = None
76    directory_dialog.Destroy()
77    return path

uses the wxPython library to use the file explorer dialog to select a directory

@param prompt: prompt which is displayed at the top of the dialog @return: a string to the path

used https://docs.wxpython.org/wx.DirDialog.html for reference

def select_file_dialog(prompt: str = 'Select a file', wildcard: str = '') -> str: 
80def select_file_dialog(prompt: str = "Select a file", wildcard: str = "") -> str:
81    """
82    uses the wxPython library to use the file explorer dialog to select a file
83    used https://docs.wxpython.org/wx.FileDialog.html for reference
84
85    @param prompt: prompt which is displayed at the top of the dialog
86    @param wildcard: wildcard parameter is used to filter which files are shown and accepted
87    @return: a string to the path
88    """
89    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
90    app = wx.App()
91    file_dialog = wx.FileDialog(None, prompt, wildcard=wildcard)
92    file_dialog.ShowModal()
93    path = file_dialog.GetPath()
94    file_dialog.Destroy()
95    return path

def find_id(parent: kivy.uix.widget.Widget, widget: kivy.uix.widget.Widget) -> str: 
 98def find_id(parent: Widget, widget: Widget) -> str:
 99    """
100    function finds the id of the widget in the parent widget's ids dictionary
101
102    @param parent: the parent widget
103    @param widget: widget to find the id of
104    @return: the id of the widget in the ids of the parent widget
105    @deprecated: this function is planned to be removed
106    """
107    for key, value in parent.ids.items():
108        if value == widget:
109            return key
110    return ""

size_hint_y

y size hint.

size_hint_y is a ~kivy.properties.NumericProperty and defaults to 1.

See size_hint_x for more information, but with widths and heights swapped.

height

Height of the widget.

height is a ~kivy.properties.NumericProperty and defaults to 100.

Keep in mind that the height property is subject to layout logic and that this has not yet happened at the time of the widget's __init__ method.

A negative height is not supported.

size_hint_x

x size hint. Represents how much space the widget should use in the direction of the x axis relative to its parent's width. Only the ~kivy.uix.layout.Layout and ~kivy.core.window.Window classes make use of the hint.

The size_hint is used by layouts for two purposes:

  • When the layout considers widgets on their own rather than in relation to its other children, the size_hint_x is a direct proportion of the parent width, normally between 0.0 and 1.0. For instance, a widget with size_hint_x=0.5 in a vertical BoxLayout will take up half the BoxLayout's width, or a widget in a FloatLayout with size_hint_x=0.2 will take up 20% of the FloatLayout width. If the size_hint is greater than 1, the widget will be wider than the parent.
  • When multiple widgets can share a row of a layout, such as in a horizontal BoxLayout, their widths will be their size_hint_x as a fraction of the sum of widget size_hints. For instance, if the size_hint_xs are (0.5, 1.0, 0.5), the first widget will have a width of 25% of the parent width.

size_hint_x is a ~kivy.properties.NumericProperty and defaults to 1.

font_size

Font size of the text, in pixels.

font_size is a ~kivy.properties.NumericProperty and defaults to 15sp.

458    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
459    def on_select_working_directory(self, button: Button):
460        """
461        callback for when the select working directory button is pressed
462        """
463        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
464        directory_path = select_directory_dialog(
465            "Select Working Directory, top level directory which holds the github repository")
466        if directory_path:
467            try:
468                main_window.zmk_config.set_working_directory(directory_path)
469                self.update_directory_path(directory_path)
470            except Exception as error:
471                main_window.zmk_error(error)
472
473    def update_directory_path(self, directory_path: str = None):
474        """
475        updates the directory path
476
477        @param directory_path: the directory path as a string or None, if it is None it will attempt to get the
478        directory path from the main window
479        """
480        if directory_path is None:
481            main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
482            if main_window is not None:
483                directory_path = main_window.zmk_config.get_working_directory()
484
485        self.box_layout.ids["working directory"].text = directory_path if directory_path else "No Directory Selected"
486
487    @staticmethod
488    def on_config_name_focus(text_input: TextInput, focus: bool):
489        """
490        Callback for when the text input for the config name is focused or unfocused, if it is unfocused it is assumed
491        that the user has finished with the text input. so the method will attempt to set the config name.
492        """
493        if focus:
494            return
495        # this is not strictly necessary to make a reference to the MainWindow, but it makes the type checking happy
496        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
497        current_config_name = main_window.zmk_config.get_config_name()
498        # attempt to set the config name
499        try:
500            main_window.zmk_config.set_config_name(name=str(text_input.text))
501        # it is "possible" to get a TypeError but because the text input is a string it should not happen
502        # hence why I added the extra message.
503        except TypeError as error:
504            error.args = (str(error) + ". If you got this error then you have managed to break something")
505            main_window.zmk_error(error)
506            text_input.text = current_config_name if current_config_name else ""
507        # if the config name already exists then raise a ValueError
508        except ValueError as error:
509            main_window.zmk_error(error)
510            text_input.text = current_config_name if current_config_name else ""
511

514        """

526        # hence why I added to the error message
527        except TypeError as error:
528            error.args = (str(error) + ". If you got this error then you have managed to break something")
529            main_window.zmk_error(error)
530            text_input.text = current_config_id if current_config_id else ""
531        # if the config id already exists then it will raise a ValueError

551        # hence why I wrote the error message like this
552        except TypeError as error:

561    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
562    def on_select_json_file(self, button: Button):
563        """
564        callback for when the select json file button is pressed
565        """
566        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
567        json_file_path = select_file_dialog("Select JSON File, file that contains the keyboard layout",
568                                            wildcard="*.json")
569        if json_file_path and json_file_path != main_window.json_file_path:
570            try:
571                # attempt to parse the json file before setting the json file path to make sure that the json file
572                # is valid
573                main_window.kle_json = pykle.parse(open(json_file_path, encoding="utf-8").read())
574                main_window.json_file_path = json_file_path
575                # because the json file has changed, the assumption is that the layout has changed and the current
576                # keymap/row/columns are no longer valid therefore they are cleared and the keymaps are redrawn
577                main_window.zmk_config.clear_key_data()
578                main_window.redraw_keymap()
579            except Exception as error:
580                main_window.zmk_error(error)
581        # update the json file path in the GUI
582        self.update_json_file_path()
583
584    def update_json_file_path(self, json_file_path: str = None):
585        """
586        updates the json file path, if no file path is passed then it will attempt to get the file path from the main
587        window
588        """
589        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
590        if main_window is None:
591            return
592        json_file_path = main_window.json_file_path if json_file_path is None else json_file_path
593        self.box_layout.ids["kle json path"].text = json_file_path if json_file_path else "No JSON File Selected"
594

596    @staticmethod
597    def on_select_mcu_button(button: Button):
598        """
599        method changes the screen manager's screen to the MCU selection screen
600        """
601        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
602        main_window.screen_manager.current = "MCU Selection"

604    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
605    def update_mcu_text(self, mcu: str = None):
606        """
607        updates the mcu text. if no mcu is passed then it will attempt to get the mcu from the main window
608        """
609        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
610        if main_window is None:
611            return
612        mcu = main_window.zmk_config.get_mcu()
613        self.box_layout.ids["selected mcu"].text = str(mcu) if mcu else "No MCU Selected"
614
615    def split_config_text_callback(self, toggle_button: ToggleButton):
616        """
617        Flipflops the text on the button for enabling the split keyboard between "Yes" and "No"
618        """
619        # used to enable or disable the split keyboard side toggle button
620        split_keyboard_side = self.box_layout.ids["split keyboard side"]
621        if toggle_button.state == "down":
622            toggle_button.text = "Yes"
623            split_keyboard_side.disabled = False
624        else:
625            toggle_button.text = "No"
626            split_keyboard_side.disabled = True
627        # update the text on the split keyboard side toggle button
628        self.split_config_side_text_callback(split_keyboard_side)
629
630    @staticmethod
631    def split_config_side_text_callback(toggle_button: ToggleButton):
632        """
633        Flipflops the text on the button for enabling the split keyboard between "Left" and "Right"
634        """
635        if toggle_button.disabled:
636            toggle_button.text = "N/A"
637        elif toggle_button.state == "down":
638            toggle_button.text = "Right"
639        else:
640            toggle_button.text = "Left"
641
642    def split_config_side_enabled(self, toggle_button: ToggleButton):
643        """
644        Enables the button for selecting the side of the split keyboard
645        """
646        if toggle_button.state == "down":
647            self.box_layout.ids["split keyboard"].disabled = True
648        else:
649            self.box_layout.ids["split keyboard"].disabled = True
650        print_debug("method called: split config side enabled")
651
652    def encoder_config_toggle_text_call_back(self, toggle_button: ToggleButton):
653        """
654        Flipflops the text on the toggle button between "Yes" and "No"
655        """
656        if toggle_button.state == "down":
657            toggle_button.text = "Yes"
658            self.box_layout.ids["number of rotary encoders"].disabled = False
659        else:
660            toggle_button.text = "No"
661            self.box_layout.ids["number of rotary encoders"].disabled = True
662
663    @staticmethod
664    def split_keyboard_side_toggle_state_callback(toggle_button: ToggleButton):
665        """
666        Flipflops the text on the toggle button between "Left" and "Right"
667        """
668        if toggle_button.state == "down":
669            toggle_button.text = "Right"
670        else:
671            toggle_button.text = "Left"
672
673    @staticmethod
674    def on_button_callback(button: Button):
675        """
676        on_button_callback is called when a button is pressed. This method is planned to be deprecated.
677        """
678        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
679        main_window.event_callback(button.method, value=button.state == "down")
680
681    def on_text_intput_focus(self, text_input: TextInput, focus: bool) -> None:
682        """
683        on_text_intput_focus is called when a text input focus changes, it is used to change the configuration option
684        once the user clicks away from the text input, so that the configuration can be updated then instead of on every
685        key press. This method is planned to be deprecated.
686        """
687        if focus:
688            return
689        key = find_id(self.box_layout, text_input)
690        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
691        main_window.event_callback(key, value=text_input.text)

Properties screen manages the main properties of the ZMK config such as: - working directory - keyboard name - layout from the keyboard layout editor json file - the microcontroller unit - whether the keyboard is a split keyboard and which side is the main side - number of paired and simultaneous connections - whether rotary encoders are used and if so how many

204        """BoxLayout is used to create a vertical list of properties"""

def on_select_working_directory(self, button: kivy.uix.button.Button): 
459    def on_select_working_directory(self, button: Button):
460        """
461        callback for when the select working directory button is pressed
462        """
463        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
464        directory_path = select_directory_dialog(
465            "Select Working Directory, top level directory which holds the github repository")

@staticmethod
def on_config_name_focus(text_input: kivy.uix.textinput.TextInput, focus: bool): 
487    @staticmethod
488    def on_config_name_focus(text_input: TextInput, focus: bool):
489        """
490        Callback for when the text input for the config name is focused or unfocused, if it is unfocused it is assumed
491        that the user has finished with the text input. so the method will attempt to set the config name.
492        """
493        if focus:
494            return
495        # this is not strictly necessary to make a reference to the MainWindow, but it makes the type checking happy
496        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
497        current_config_name = main_window.zmk_config.get_config_name()
498        # attempt to set the config name
499        try:
500            main_window.zmk_config.set_config_name(name=str(text_input.text))
501        # it is "possible" to get a TypeError but because the text input is a string it should not happen
502        # hence why I added the extra message.
503        except TypeError as error:
504            error.args = (str(error) + ". If you got this error then you have managed to break something")
505            main_window.zmk_error(error)
506            text_input.text = current_config_name if current_config_name else ""
507        # if the config name already exists then raise a ValueError
508        except ValueError as error:
509            main_window.zmk_error(error)
510            text_input.text = current_config_name if current_config_name else ""

Callback for when the text input for the config name is focused or unfocused, if it is unfocused it is assumed that the user has finished with the text input. so the method will attempt to set the config name.

def on_select_json_file(self, button: kivy.uix.button.Button): 
562    def on_select_json_file(self, button: Button):
563        """
564        callback for when the select json file button is pressed
565        """
566        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
567        json_file_path = select_file_dialog("Select JSON File, file that contains the keyboard layout",
568                                            wildcard="*.json")
569        if json_file_path and json_file_path != main_window.json_file_path:
570            try:
571                # attempt to parse the json file before setting the json file path to make sure that the json file
572                # is valid
573                main_window.kle_json = pykle.parse(open(json_file_path, encoding="utf-8").read())
574                main_window.json_file_path = json_file_path
575                # because the json file has changed, the assumption is that the layout has changed and the current
576                # keymap/row/columns are no longer valid therefore they are cleared and the keymaps are redrawn
577                main_window.zmk_config.clear_key_data()
578                main_window.redraw_keymap()
579            except Exception as error:
580                main_window.zmk_error(error)
581        # update the json file path in the GUI
582        self.update_json_file_path()

callback for when the select json file button is pressed

def update_json_file_path(self, json_file_path: str = None): 
584    def update_json_file_path(self, json_file_path: str = None):
585        """
586        updates the json file path, if no file path is passed then it will attempt to get the file path from the main
587        window
588        """
589        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
590        if main_window is None:
591            return
592        json_file_path = main_window.json_file_path if json_file_path is None else json_file_path
593        self.box_layout.ids["kle json path"].text = json_file_path if json_file_path else "No JSON File Selected"

class KeyWidget(kivy.uix.scatter.Scatter): 
694class KeyWidget(Scatter):
695    """
696    This class is a super class which will be used to create keys which will form the visual representation
697    of the keyboard
698    """
699
700    def __init__(self, key_index: int, **kwargs):
701        """
702        The constructor for the KeyWidget class, key_index is taken so that it can fetch the key from the kle data. Then
703        along with maths it will render the key with the correct size and position, and rotation if needed.
704
705        @param key_index: the index of the key in from the pykle.KeyBoard.keys list
706        """
707        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
708        key: pykle.Key = main_window.kle_json.keys[key_index]
709        super().__init__(**kwargs)
710        self.kivy_y = 0
711        self.key_index = key_index
712        self.size_hint = (None, None)
713        self.size = key.width * std.STD_KEY_UNIT, key.height * std.STD_KEY_UNIT
714        self.do_translation = False
715
716        # if there is rotation in the key, then the maths needs to be figured out to render the key correctly
717        if key.rotation_angle != 0:
718            # calculate the centre of the key so that the rotation can be done around the centre of the key
719            key_center = (key.x + key.width / 2, key.y + key.height / 2)
720            # storing the point of rotation as a tuple as its easier to work with
721            point_of_rotation = (key.rotation_x, key.rotation_y)
722            # calculate the position vector of the centre of the key relative to the point of rotation
723            rel_position_vector = func.subtract_vectors(key_center, point_of_rotation)
724            # calculate the magnitude of the position vector
725            magnitude = func.magnitude(rel_position_vector)
726            # calculating the new centre position relative to the point of rotation
727            theta = func.calculate_angle(rel_position_vector)
728            new_theta = theta - math.radians(key.rotation_angle)
729            new_rel_position_vector = (magnitude * math.sin(new_theta), magnitude * math.cos(new_theta))
730            # calculating the position of the bottom left corner of the key relative to the point of rotation
731            new_rel_bl_pos_vector = (new_rel_position_vector[0] - key.width / 2,
732                                     new_rel_position_vector[1] + key.height / 2)
733            # calculating the new position of the bottom left corner of the key
734            new_bl_pos_vector = func.add_vectors(point_of_rotation, new_rel_bl_pos_vector)
735            # calculating the new position of the key for kivy
736            self.kivy_y = new_bl_pos_vector[1] * std.STD_KEY_UNIT
737            self.pos = (new_bl_pos_vector[0] * std.STD_KEY_UNIT, main_window.screen_manager.height - self.kivy_y)
738            self.do_rotation = True
739            self.rotation = -key.rotation_angle
740        else:
741            self.do_rotation = False
742            self.rotation = 0
743            self.kivy_y = (key.y + key.height) * std.STD_KEY_UNIT
744            self.pos = (key.x * std.STD_KEY_UNIT, main_window.screen_manager.height - self.kivy_y)
745
746        with self.canvas:
747            Color(1, 1, 1, 0.5)
748            Rectangle(pos_hint={"center_x": 0.5, "center_y": 0.5},
749                      size=(key.width * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP,
750                            key.height * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP))
751
752        main_window.screen_manager.bind(height=self.on_height)
753
754    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal
755    def on_height(self, screen_manager: ScreenManager, height):
756        """
757        on_height is called when the height of the window changes, this is used to update the position of the key to
758        ensure that it stays at the top of the window
759
760        @param screen_manager: the screen manager which is bound to the event
761        @param height: the new height of the screen_manager widget
762        """
763        self.y = height - self.kivy_y

This class is a super class which will be used to create keys which will form the visual representation of the keyboard

class RowColumnScreen(kivy.uix.screenmanager.Screen): 
766class RowColumnScreen(Screen):
767    """
768    RowColumnScreen allows user to configure the rows and columns of the keyboard
769    """
770
771
772
773
774    class RowColumnWidget(KeyWidget):
775        """
776        Inherits the KeyWidget class and adds box layout to create a widget which can be used to configure the rows and
777        columns for keys of the keyboard.
778        """
779
780        def __init__(self, index):
781            """
782            method adds a box layout which contains two text inputs, one for the row and one for the column
783
784            @param index: refer to KeyWidget's constructor for the purpose of this parameter
785            """
786            super().__init__(index)
787            # grabs the key object from the kle json
788            main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
789            key: pykle.Key = main_window.kle_json.keys[index]
790            # creates a box layout which will contain the text inputs
791            box_layout = BoxLayout(orientation="horizontal", size_hint=(None, None), spacing=std.STD_KEY_GAP / 4)
792            box_layout.pos_hint = {"center_x": 0.5, "center_y": 0.5}
793            box_layout.size = (key.width * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP,
794                               key.height * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP)
795            # creates the text inputs, self.row and self.column are used to store the values of the text inputs
796            # as integers and are updated when the text of the text inputs are changed if both text inputs are
797            # integers then the row and column objects in the transform object of the zmk_config object are updated
798            self.row: int | None = None
799            self.row_input = TextInput(hint_text="R", input_filter="int", size_hint=(1, 1), multiline=False,
800                                       halign="center")
801            self.column: int | None = None
802            self.row_input.bind(text=self.on_text)
803            self.col_input = TextInput(hint_text="C", input_filter="int", size_hint=(1, 1), multiline=False,
804                                       halign="center")
805            self.col_input.bind(text=self.on_text)
806            box_layout.add_widget(self.row_input)
807            box_layout.add_widget(self.col_input)
808            self.add_widget(box_layout)
809
810        def on_text(self, text_input: TextInput, value: str):
811            """
812            Method is called when the text of the text input is changed
813
814            @param text_input: widget which called the method
815            @param value: the new text from the text input
816            """
817            # if the text input is empty then the value is set to None
818            if value == "":
819                value = None
820
821            # if the instance of the text input is the row_input
822            # then the value is set provided that it is not None
823            if text_input == self.row_input and value is not None:
824                self.row = int(value)
825            # otherwise it is safe to assume that the instance is the col_input
826            # so the value is set provided that it is not None
827            elif value is not None:
828                self.column = int(value)
829
830            # if both the row and column are integers then the row and column objects in the transform object
831            if isinstance(self.row, int) and isinstance(self.column, int):
832                main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
833                transform: ZMK.Transform.MatrixTransform = main_window.zmk_config.get_transform()
834                # attempts to add the row and column to the transform object
835                # if an error occurs, which shouldn't happen in the current implementation,
836                # then the error is displayed to the user
837                try:
838                    transform.add_key(self.row, self.column, index=self.key_index)
839                except Exception as error:
840                    main_window.zmk_error(error)
841
842
843
844
845    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
846        super().__init__(**kwargs)
847        self.size_hint = 1, 1
848        self.float_layout = FloatLayout(size_hint=(1, 1))
849        """Float layout is used as this allows for absolute positioning of KeyWidgets"""
850        self.add_widget(self.float_layout)
851
852    def on_parent(self, widget: RowColumnScreen, parent: ScreenManager):
853        """
854        on_parent is called when this widget is added to a parent widget
855
856        @param widget: self
857        @param parent: the parent widget, ScreenManager
858        """
859        print_debug(f"{self.__class__.__name__}: {widget} {parent}", info="ON PARENT")
860
861    def redraw_keymap(self):
862        """
863        Method is called when the keymap needs to be redrawn
864        """
865        self.float_layout.clear_widgets()
866        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
867        for index in range(len(main_window.kle_json.keys)):
868            self.float_layout.add_widget(self.RowColumnWidget(index=index))

class RowColumnScreen.RowColumnWidget(KeyWidget): 
774    class RowColumnWidget(KeyWidget):
775        """
776        Inherits the KeyWidget class and adds box layout to create a widget which can be used to configure the rows and
777        columns for keys of the keyboard.
778        """
779
780        def __init__(self, index):
781            """
782            method adds a box layout which contains two text inputs, one for the row and one for the column
783
784            @param index: refer to KeyWidget's constructor for the purpose of this parameter
785            """
786            super().__init__(index)
787            # grabs the key object from the kle json
788            main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
789            key: pykle.Key = main_window.kle_json.keys[index]
790            # creates a box layout which will contain the text inputs
791            box_layout = BoxLayout(orientation="horizontal", size_hint=(None, None), spacing=std.STD_KEY_GAP / 4)
792            box_layout.pos_hint = {"center_x": 0.5, "center_y": 0.5}
793            box_layout.size = (key.width * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP,
794                               key.height * std.STD_KEY_UNIT - std.STD_KEY_GAP)
795            # creates the text inputs, self.row and self.column are used to store the values of the text inputs
796            # as integers and are updated when the text of the text inputs are changed if both text inputs are
797            # integers then the row and column objects in the transform object of the zmk_config object are updated
798            self.row: int | None = None
799            self.row_input = TextInput(hint_text="R", input_filter="int", size_hint=(1, 1), multiline=False,
800                                       halign="center")
801            self.column: int | None = None
802            self.row_input.bind(text=self.on_text)
803            self.col_input = TextInput(hint_text="C", input_filter="int", size_hint=(1, 1), multiline=False,
804                                       halign="center")
805            self.col_input.bind(text=self.on_text)
806            box_layout.add_widget(self.row_input)
807            box_layout.add_widget(self.col_input)
808            self.add_widget(box_layout)
809
810        def on_text(self, text_input: TextInput, value: str):
811            """
812            Method is called when the text of the text input is changed
813
814            @param text_input: widget which called the method
815            @param value: the new text from the text input
816            """
817            # if the text input is empty then the value is set to None
818            if value == "":
819                value = None
820
821            # if the instance of the text input is the row_input
822            # then the value is set provided that it is not None
823            if text_input == self.row_input and value is not None:
824                self.row = int(value)
825            # otherwise it is safe to assume that the instance is the col_input
826            # so the value is set provided that it is not None
827            elif value is not None:
828                self.column = int(value)
829
830            # if both the row and column are integers then the row and column objects in the transform object
831            if isinstance(self.row, int) and isinstance(self.column, int):
832                main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
833                transform: ZMK.Transform.MatrixTransform = main_window.zmk_config.get_transform()
834                # attempts to add the row and column to the transform object
835                # if an error occurs, which shouldn't happen in the current implementation,
836                # then the error is displayed to the user
837                try:
838                    transform.add_key(self.row, self.column, index=self.key_index)
839                except Exception as error:
840                    main_window.zmk_error(error)

class GpioScreen(kivy.uix.screenmanager.Screen): 
871class GpioScreen(Screen):
872    """
873    GpioScreen allows user to configure the GPIO pins of the keyboard
874    """
875
876    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
877        super().__init__(**kwargs)
878        self.float_layout = FloatLayout(size_hint=(1, 1))
879        """Float layout is used as place holder for the widgets, a boxlayout or something similar will be used later"""
880        self.in_focus = False
881        self.add_widget(self.float_layout)
882
883    def on_parent(self, widget: GpioScreen, parent: ScreenManager):
884        """
885        on_parent is called when this widget is added to a parent widget
886
887        @param widget: self
888        @param parent: the parent widget, ScreenManager
889        """
890        print_debug(f"{self.__class__.__name__}: {widget} {parent}", info="ON PARENT")
891        if not self.float_layout.children:
892            # label placeholder
893            self.float_layout.add_widget(Label(
894                text="GpioScreen",
895                font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE * 3
896            ))
897            self.ids["placeholder label"] = self.float_layout.children[0]

937        self.add_widget(self.float_layout)

939    def redraw_keymap(self):
940        """
941        Method is called when the keymap needs to be redrawn
942        """
943        self.float_layout.clear_widgets()
944        main_window: MainWindow = App.get_running_app().root
945        for index in range(len(main_window.kle_json.keys)):
946            self.float_layout.add_widget(self.KeyMapWidget(index=index))

class ConsoleScreen(kivy.uix.screenmanager.Screen): 
1006class ConsoleScreen(Screen):
1007    """
1008    ConsoleScreen allows user to view the console output
1009    """
1010
1011    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
1012        super().__init__(**kwargs)
1013        self.scroll_view = ScrollView(size_hint=(1, 1), do_scroll_x=False, do_scroll_y=True)
1014        self.in_focus = False
1015        self.console_history = []
1016        self.label: [Label, None] = None
1017
1018    def on_parent(self, widget: ConsoleScreen, parent: ScreenManager):
1019        """
1020        on_parent is called when this widget is added to a parent widget
1021
1022        @param widget: self
1023        @param parent: the parent widget, ScreenManager
1024        """
1025        print_debug(f"{self.__class__.__name__}: {widget} {parent}", info="ON PARENT")
1026        if self.parent and not self.scroll_view.children:
1027            # scroll view to hold the console
1028            self.label = Label(text="", font_size=std.STD_FONT_SIZE)
1029            self.label.size_hint_y = None
1030            self.label.size_hint_x = None
1031            self.label.bind(texture_size=self.label_setter)
1032            self.scroll_view.add_widget(self.label)
1033            self.add_widget(self.scroll_view)
1034
1035    # noinspection PyIncorrectDocstring
1036    def label_setter(self, label: Label, size: tuple[int, int]):
1037        """
1038        label_setter sets the dynamic attributes of the label which is the console
1039
1040        @param size: texture size of the label
1041        @param label: the label widget
1042        """
1043        label.width = self.width
1044        label.height = size[1]
1045        label.text_size = (self.width * 0.98, None)
1046
1047    def update_console(self, console_history: str):
1048        """
1049        update_console updates the console history and the label text
1050
1051        @param console_history: A string which is the latest message to be added to the console
1052        """
1053        self.console_history.append(console_history)
1054        self.label.text = "\n".join(self.console_history)
1055        self.scroll_view.scroll_y = 0
